SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT023
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message is the response to an MT 022 Retrieval Request (History). It contains only message history. When a user requests retrieval of multiple messages, the response consists of separate sections for each message. The sections are sent in system MIR order.
The maximum retrieval period for live messages is 124 days from the date of input to the system. For Test& Training messages the period is 4 days.
From: GPA or FIN To: User
Format The format of this message can be broken down logically into groups of fields as follows: • Report details • Information on the retrieved messages • Next retrieval criteria

SystemField.Name: section-number
SystemField.description: Sequential section number, beginning with 0001, identifying the position of an individual message in a multiple-section message.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: section-number
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Sequential section number, beginning with 0001, identifying the position of an individual message in a multiple-section message.

SystemField.Name: total-sections
SystemField.description: Total number of sections in a multi-section message.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: total-sections
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Total number of sections in a multi-section message.

SystemField.Name: input-history
SystemField.description:
Message input history, containing:
a) Input time of message
b) MIR
c) Accepted or rejected (Y or N)
d) If rejected, error code and line number (in banking message) or field number (in system message)
Time in MIR is local to the sender.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: input-history
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Message input history, containing:
a) Input time of message
b) MIR
c) Accepted or rejected (Y or N)
d) If rejected, error code and line number (in banking message) or field number (in system message)
Time in MIR is local to the sender.

Validation.actionmessage: "Invalid Timestamp '" + $value + "'. time should be in the format HHmm."
"Invalid Acceptance value '" + $value + "'. acceptance value should be Y or N."

SystemField.Name: mur
SystemField.description: For FIN, the message user reference assigned by the sender of a message. Contains one of the following: Message User Reference as used in the header of the original message if present. Contents of field 20 of the original message, if the message user reference was not present, but only if alphabetical characters were in upper case Contents of field 20C, with the codeword SEME and the number (only for category 5 messages), but only if alphabetical characters were in upper case.Tag 108 with only blanks (spaces) is accepted by the system.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: mur
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Message User Reference as used in the header of the original message

SystemField.Name: msg-status
SystemField.description: Message status (for example, whether delivered or aborted). See FIN Error Codes module for the full set of error codes.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: msg-status
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: Message status (for example, whether delivered or aborted). See the FIN Error Codes module for the full set of error codes.

SystemField.Name: delivery-history
SystemField.description:
Message delivery history, noting each delivery attempt. For each attempt, it contains:
a) Output time of message
b) MOR
c) Accepted or rejected (Y or N)
d) If rejected, an error code if UNKed:
a) A00 = aborted
b) D03 = cancelled
c) D07 = requeued due to user SYNC request
d) D08 = requeued due to session abort
e) D09 = requeued due to system recovery
f) D12 = positive UAK text format error
g) Ynn = rejected by receiver

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: delivery-history
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Message delivery history, noting each delivery attempt. For each attempt, it contains:
a) Output time of message
b) MOR
c) Accepted or rejected (Y or N)
d) If rejected, an error code if UNKed:
a) A00 = aborted
b) D03 = cancelled
c) D07 = requeued due to user SYNC request
d) D08 = requeued due to session abort
e) D09 = requeued due to system recovery
f) D12 = positive UAK text format error
g) Ynn = rejected by receiver

SystemField.Name: mir-range
SystemField.description:
Range of MIRs for retrieval. The MIRs consist of:
a) Date of input of the message
b) Sending LT and branch code XXX (irrespective of which branch code was used in the original message)
c) Session number
d) ISN
An optional time range criterion can be specified.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: mir-range
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Range of MIRs for retrieval. The MIRs consist of:
a) Date of input of the message
b) Sending LT and branch code XXX (irrespective of which branch code was used in the original message)
c) Session number
d) ISN
An optional time range criterion can be specified.

SystemField.Name: mor-range
SystemField.description:
Range of MORs for retrieval. The MORs consist of:
a) Date of output of the message
b) Receiving LT and branch code XXX (irrespective of which branch code was used in the original message)
c) Session number
d) OSN
An optional time range criterion can be specified.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: mor-range
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Range of MORs for retrieval. The MORs consist of:
a) Date of output of the message
b) Receiving LT and branch code XXX (irrespective of which branch code was used in the original message)
c) Session number
d) OSN
An optional time range criterion can be specified.

SystemField.Name: msg-input-type
SystemField.description:
Message input type, containing:
a) Input LT including branch code XXX
b) Input session
c) Message type
d) Input date
e) Input time range

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Name: msg-input-type
SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description:
Message input type, containing:
a) Input LT including branch code XXX
b) Input session
c) Message type
d) Input date
e) Input time range

SystemField.description: First ISN to be retrieved in a multiple input message retrieval.

SwiftSystemFieldDef.Description: First ISN to be retrieved in a multiple input message retrieval.

fieldvalidation.name: E1
fieldvalidation.comment: Only ONE of the following fields or field groups must be present.
